Extension Methods

Thursday, January 22, 2015

Overview

This is how you extend a class that already exists and that you don’t have access to. More info can be found here.

Examples

First declare a static class, then create a static method that has this in front of the first parameter… Done!

 1 public class Extensions {
 2     public static void SayHello(this Person person) {
 3         Console.WriteLine("Hello, my name is {0} and I'm {1}", person.Name, person.Age);
 4     }
 5 
 6     public static void SayThing(this Person person, string thing) {
 7         Console.WriteLine("Hello {0} said {1}", thing, person.Name);
 8     }
 9 }
10 
11 public class Program {
12     public static void Main(string[] args) {
13        var person = new Person { Name="Tom", Age=5 };
14        person.SayHello();         // Hello, my name is Tom and I'm 5
15        person.SayThing("Random"); // Hello Random said Tom
16     }
17 }
